intro: Sideroxylon pervillei, commonly known as the Perville's ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Sideroxylon pervillei is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its unique botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecological systems.
